metadata.title: CVE-2022-0669 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in dpdk. This flaw allows a malicious vhost-user master toattach an unexpected number of fds as ancillary data toVHOST_USER_GET_INFLIGHT_FD / VHOST_USER_SET_INFLIGHT_FD messages that arenot closed by the vhost-user slave. By sending such messages continuously,the vhost-user master exhausts available fd in the vhost-user slaveprocess, leading to a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dpdk - 19.11.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
dpdk-igb-uio-dkms - 19.11.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
librte-acl20.0 - 19.11.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
